title: QuickTime HD H.264 codec tip
body: <blockquote>Here is a tip for all those people that want to play those QuickTime HD clips (the ones that use the new H.264 codec). You can play them with the K-Lite Mega Codec Pack. Download the files to your harddrive. Then simply rename the files from .mov to .mp4. The required codecs are: Haali's MP4 splitter and ffdshow (for H.264 and AAC). Playback will be faster and better than with the new QuickTime 7!</blockquote><p>(from <a href="http://www.codecguide.com/">K-Lite Codec Resource Site</a>)</p><p>I <strong>highly</strong> recommend installing the <a href="http://www.codecguide.com/download_mega.htm" title="MEGA!!">Mega</a> version, as long as you read the instructions during installation. I can't remember the last time I had to install Realplayer or Quicktime.</p>

QuickTime HD H.264 codec tip

Here is a tip for all those people that want to play those QuickTime HD clips (the ones that use the new H.264 codec). You can play them with the K-Lite Mega Codec Pack. Download the files to your harddrive. Then simply rename the files from .mov to .mp4. The required codecs are: Haali's MP4 splitter and ffdshow (for H.264 and AAC). Playback will be faster and better than with the new QuickTime 7!
